com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler

Class DefaultScheduler.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.DefaultScheduler.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    DefaultScheduler

    public static class DefaultScheduler.Builder
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates a new DefaultScheduler. See information about parameters in DefaultScheduler.Builder.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      DefaultScheduler build()
      Creates a new scheduler instance with the provided values or their defaults.
      ConfigStore<ServiceSpec> getConfigStore()
      Returns the ConfigStore provided via setConfigStore(ConfigStore), or a reasonable default created via DefaultScheduler#createConfigStore(ServiceSpec, Collection).
      java.util.Collection<Plan> getPlans(StateStore stateStore, ConfigStore<ServiceSpec> configStore)
      Gets or generate plans against the given service spec.
      SchedulerFlags getSchedulerFlags()
      Returns the SchedulerFlags object which was provided via the constructor.
      ServiceSpec getServiceSpec()
      Returns the ServiceSpec which was provided via the constructor.
      StateStore getStateStore()
      Returns the StateStore provided via setStateStore(StateStore), or a reasonable default created via DefaultScheduler#createStateStore(ServiceSpec, SchedulerFlags).
      static java.util.Collection<Plan> overrideDeployPlan(java.util.Collection<Plan> plans, ConfigurationUpdater.UpdateResult updateResult)
      Given the plans specified and the update scenario, the deploy plan may be overriden by a specified update plan.
      DefaultScheduler.Builder setConfigStore(ConfigStore<ServiceSpec> configStore)
      Specifies a custom ConfigStore.
      DefaultScheduler.Builder setCustomConfigValidators(java.util.Collection<ConfigValidator<ServiceSpec>> customConfigValidators)
      Specifies a custom list of configuration validators to be run when updating to a new target configuration, or otherwise uses the default validators returned by DefaultScheduler#defaultConfigValidators().
      DefaultScheduler.Builder setCustomResources(java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object> customResources)
      Specifies custom endpoint resources which should be exposed through the scheduler's API server, in addition to the defaults.
      DefaultScheduler.Builder setEndpointProducer(java.lang.String name, EndpointProducer endpointProducer)
      Specifies a custom EndpointProducer to be added to the /endpoints API.
      DefaultScheduler.Builder setPlans(java.util.Collection<Plan> plans)
      Sets the provided Plans to this instance.
      DefaultScheduler.Builder setPlansFrom(RawServiceSpec rawServiceSpec)
      Sets the Plans from the provided RawServiceSpec to this instance, using a DefaultPlanGenerator to handle conversion.
      DefaultScheduler.Builder setRecoveryManagerFactory(RecoveryPlanOverriderFactory recoveryPlanOverriderFactory)
      Sets the provided PlanManager to be the plan manager used for recovery.
      DefaultScheduler.Builder setStateStore(StateStore stateStore)
      Specifies a custom StateStore, otherwise the return value of DefaultScheduler#createStateStore(ServiceSpec, SchedulerFlags) will be used.

    • Method Detail

      • getServiceSpec

        public ServiceSpec getServiceSpec()
        Returns the ServiceSpec which was provided via the constructor.

      • getSchedulerFlags

        public SchedulerFlags getSchedulerFlags()
        Returns the SchedulerFlags object which was provided via the constructor.

      • setStateStore

        public DefaultScheduler.Builder setStateStore(StateStore stateStore)
        Specifies a custom StateStore, otherwise the return value of DefaultScheduler#createStateStore(ServiceSpec, SchedulerFlags) will be used. The state store persists copies of task information and task status for all tasks running in the service.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the state store is already set, via a previous call to either setStateStore(StateStore) or to getStateStore()

      • getStateStore

        public StateStore getStateStore()
        Returns the StateStore provided via setStateStore(StateStore), or a reasonable default created via DefaultScheduler#createStateStore(ServiceSpec, SchedulerFlags). In order to avoid cohesiveness issues between this setting and the build() step, setStateStore(StateStore) may not be invoked after this has been called.

      • setConfigStore

        public DefaultScheduler.Builder setConfigStore(ConfigStore<ServiceSpec> configStore)
        Specifies a custom ConfigStore. The config store persists a copy of the current configuration ('target' configuration), while also storing historical configurations.

      • getConfigStore

        public ConfigStore<ServiceSpec> getConfigStore()
        Returns the ConfigStore provided via setConfigStore(ConfigStore), or a reasonable default created via DefaultScheduler#createConfigStore(ServiceSpec, Collection). In order to avoid cohesiveness issues between this setting and the build() step, setConfigStore(ConfigStore) may not be invoked after this has been called.

      • setCustomResources

        public DefaultScheduler.Builder setCustomResources(java.util.Collection<java.lang.Object> customResources)
        Specifies custom endpoint resources which should be exposed through the scheduler's API server, in addition to the defaults.

      • setCustomConfigValidators

        public DefaultScheduler.Builder setCustomConfigValidators(java.util.Collection<ConfigValidator<ServiceSpec>> customConfigValidators)
        Specifies a custom list of configuration validators to be run when updating to a new target configuration, or otherwise uses the default validators returned by DefaultScheduler#defaultConfigValidators().

      • setEndpointProducer

        public DefaultScheduler.Builder setEndpointProducer(java.lang.String name,
                                                    EndpointProducer endpointProducer)
        Specifies a custom EndpointProducer to be added to the /endpoints API. This may be used by services which wish to expose custom endpoint information via that API.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the endpoint to be exposed
        endpointProducer - the producer to be invoked when the provided endpoint name is requested

      • setPlansFrom

        public DefaultScheduler.Builder setPlansFrom(RawServiceSpec rawServiceSpec)
                                      throws ConfigStoreException
        Sets the Plans from the provided RawServiceSpec to this instance, using a DefaultPlanGenerator to handle conversion. This is overridden by any plans manually provided by setPlans(Collection).
        Throws:
        ConfigStoreException - if creating a default config store fails
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the plans were already set either via this call or via setPlans(Collection)

      • setPlans

        public DefaultScheduler.Builder setPlans(java.util.Collection<Plan> plans)
        Sets the provided Plans to this instance. This may be used when no RawServiceSpec is available, and overrides any calls to setPlansFrom(RawServiceSpec).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the plans were already set either via this call or via setPlansFrom(RawServiceSpec)

      • setRecoveryManagerFactory

        public DefaultScheduler.Builder setRecoveryManagerFactory(RecoveryPlanOverriderFactory recoveryPlanOverriderFactory)
        Sets the provided PlanManager to be the plan manager used for recovery.
        Parameters:
        recoveryPlanOverriderFactory - the factory whcih generates the custom recovery plan manager

      • getPlans

        public java.util.Collection<Plan> getPlans(StateStore stateStore,
                                           ConfigStore<ServiceSpec> configStore)
        Gets or generate plans against the given service spec.
        Parameters:
        stateStore - The state store to use for plan generation.
        configStore - The config store to use for plan generation.
        Returns:
        a collection of plans

      • build

        public DefaultScheduler build()
        Creates a new scheduler instance with the provided values or their defaults.
        Returns:
        a new scheduler instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if config validation failed when updating the target config.

      • overrideDeployPlan

        public static java.util.Collection<Plan> overrideDeployPlan(java.util.Collection<Plan> plans,
                                                            ConfigurationUpdater.UpdateResult updateResult)
        Given the plans specified and the update scenario, the deploy plan may be overriden by a specified update plan.
